paper_abstract: We prove that a uniform, rooted unordered binary tree (also known as rooted, binary Polya tree) with n leaves has the Brownian continuum random tree as its scaling limit for the Gromov-Hausdorff topology. The limit is thus, up to a constant factor, the same as that of uniform plane trees or labeled trees. Our analysis rests on a combinatorial and probabilistic study of appropriate trimming procedures of trees. (C) 2010 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 38, 467-501, 2011
paper_title: The CRT is the Scaling Limit of Unordered Binary Trees
